description: Imagine drawing together to tend to our sick and dying in true ceremony: to witness and truly listen to, and to honour the stories of those moving through the passages of infirmity to death; to pay homage to, and to prepare the bodies of our loved-ones with tenderness and dignity. • Imagine if we knew the truth that is embedded in our cells: that we *are* each other; that division and segregation are an illusion; that the apartheid we are being convinced to embrace and to normalize is a reflection of a kind of impulse to violence and fracture that is not part of our essential nature as human beings. • I’m so moved by the outpouring of love and support for my recent video. This quote comes from the “part two” that I’m about to upload...which is considerably more personal than part one...and it’s scary to be sharing material like this, at a time like this. • I don’t like to be bullied, and I fact, I will not be (one of my great strengths, one of my great vulnerabilities, one of the areas in which my ego is largest, and weakest 😔. Oh well. 🥴😂🤷🏻‍♀️). #bauhauswife #covid1984 #plandemic #livefreeordie #idonotconsent
